Image Generators

There are multiple Image Generators but still there some better and some worse.

Begin the journey

Topics

Stable Diffiusion
Crayion
Dall-E 2

Stable Diffiusion

Stable Diffusion is the inspiration behind this article and a tool I've personally been playing around with a lot lately.
It runs locally on your computer (so you don't compete for resources with other users of an online tool) and is one of the most powerful you can currently use.
Not only can you use it to fine-tune a lot of parameters, but you can also control the entire generation process.

Crayion

Craiyon is completely free to use and accessible through its website.
You can generate any image from any command prompt and the only catch is that the images are of lower quality and you have to wait about two minutes for each batch of images generated.
Craiyon started out as an open-source model with the goal of reproducing the results of the original DALL·E model. The model now in use is known as the DALL·E Mega and includes several improvements.

Dall-E 2

Dall-E 2 is a product of OpenAI research lab and is the most famous AI image generator that people think of.
It's a closed tool with limited access, but for those who can access it, some of the results it can produce are incredible.
It was initially shut down due to concerns about the ethics and safety of such a tool, although it has been gradually expanded over time.
